snippet: People had dumped things like mattresses and garbage in Bushwick, Brooklyn, but never a coffin, especially not one with bones still inside.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column describes New York City Police Dept investigation of coffin, containing human bones, found abandoned on a street in Bushwick, Brooklyn; police determine that coffin was illegally dumped following poorly-executed move of a body from a Staten Island cemetery to one on Long Island.
lead_paragraph: People had dumped things like mattresses and garbage in Bushwick, Brooklyn, but never a coffin, especially not one with bones still inside.

headline.print_headline: Investigating the Journey of a Coffin, With Bones, to a Brooklyn Street
headline.main: Investigating the Journey of a Coffin, With Bones, to a Brooklyn Street
